intro: Gallitrichum ptychophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gallnut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, waxy leaves. The plant produces unique galls, which are growths caused by insect-induced responses, often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
